comment.author: 74004041@N06
comment._content: I actually saw a car sink there after careening down the hill on the left during a big rainstorm and when all the roads around the Royal National Park were closed during 1998.

comment.author: 8108294@N05
comment._content: The car on the causeway looks like a Morris Minor 1000, a model reportedly introduced in 1956.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content:
For some reason,   comments don't work on the photo two to the right of this one,  so I will make this comment about that photo here.

It isn't Kangaroo Valley,   it isn't Maldon,   it is  Northbridge and Cammeray !

I kid you not !

The person who thought this was the Hampden Bridge,  obviously hasn't been there or wasn't thinking very hard.   The asymmetric two-level crenellation is quite distinctive  and not present at either Kangaroo Valley nor at Malden.   The end of Long Bay under the bridge has been filled in for playing fields.

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: For some odd technical reason,   commenting still doesn't work on the photo two before this one.   Although someone else has managed to add a comment there since Sunday.    How does that work then ?
